page.title: 06Waltham St Lawrence places
page.content:
{ The War Memorial}is situated on a triangle of grass at the road junction called{Paradise Corner}. It is a stone cross erected in 1920 to commemorate those men from the village who died in the 1914-18 war.
{ Paradise Corner}is named after the large house called {Paradise}which is at the corner. Some people say it is called Paradise corner because it is so dangerous that crossing the junction is a quick way to paradise!
{ The Neville Hall}is in the village near the church it is used for a{Play {School, Parish Council Meetings, {Brownies, jumble sales, parties}and as a{Doctor's Surgery}The hall was restored to use in 1970 using money from{The Shottesbrooke Trust}and work by the people of the parish.
